page.title: 18SUTTON MANOR COLLIERY.
page.content: Although the colliery does not lie within the limits of our allocated block, it was included in our survey because it has a significant effect upon it. Drifts run as far as Widnes, to the south of our block and people travel both from and through our block to work there. (Brevity dictates note form.) 800 employees.Youngest 16. Average wage Â£150. Pit opened 1906. Depth 800m. Maximum drift length 5km. 24 hour operation. Shifts; 7am-3pm, 3pm-11pm, 11pm-6am approximately. Most accidents mostly during machinery transport. Coal to power stations, homes, factories. Mainly C.E.G.B. 2000 t extracted/day. Gas testing by methanometers. Twin shaft pit to circulate air. Most workers local but some travel from North wales daily.Now efficiency improving with Â£17.5m input
